par.name: sProp
par.note: One of the valid CSS strings for this property

x_symbol.return: string, element.style.display if it exists else null

comment.author: mf
comment.note: Unless we go with something like alternative 2 then this function may not be very useful.

comment.author: mf
comment.note: Original: [code]function xDisplay(e,s) { if(!(e=xGetElementById(e))) return null; if(e.style && xDef(e.style.display)) { if (xStr(s)) e.style.display = s; return e.style.display; } return null; }[/code] Alternative 2: [code]function xDisplay(e,s) { if ((e=xGetElementById(e)) && e.style && xDef(e.style.display)) { if (xStr(s)) { if (s == 'block' && e.nodeName) { /////// ??? var ie = 'block'; switch (e.nodeName.toLowerCase()) { case 'table': s = 'table'; break; case 'tr': s = 'table-row'; break; case 'td': case 'th': s = 'table-cell'; break; case 'li': s = 'list-item'; break; case 'caption': s = 'table-caption'; ie = 'inline'; break; // inline (IE6dn) case 'tbody': s = 'table-row-group'; ie = ''; break; // not rendered case 'thead': s = 'table-header-group'; ie = ''; break; // not rendered case 'tfoot': s = 'table-footer-group'; ie = ''; break; // not rendered case 'col': s = 'table-column'; break; case 'colgroup': s = 'table-column-group'; break; } try { e.style.display = s; } catch (e) { e.style.display = ie; } } else e.style.display = s; } return e.style.display; } return null; }[/code]

rev.note: Using try/catch since IE6dn doesn't support the table css properties. Thanks very much to Edward Glowacki.
